attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As a young disabled person with poor fine motor control, I am constantly dropping coins and holding up queues of people whenever I go shopping. Due to this embarrassment, I tend to use notes, and have a large bag at home where I store all my coins, however, the smallest note currently in circulation is £5, this means that I revive even more change and my bag grows ever larger. I have developed ways of coping, I add up the items and get the money ready before I check-out, unfortunately I am also dyslexic and don’t always add up correctly.
The reintroduction of the £1 note would greatly benefit me, other disabled people, elderly people, and people with Parkinsons etc.
Thank you
